title: Ticket #3255: Implement JobPrioArray and JobPrioArrayOverflow attrs in submitter ad
description: As a development milestone in support of honoring job priorities across multiple schedds, modify the Schedd to report JobPrioArray and JobPrioArrayOverflow attributes. See the parent ticket for design document and further details.
remarks:
2012-Oct-05 14:24:24 by tannenba:
Testing...

Set the following config knobs: 

   use_global_job_prios = true
   max_global_job_prios = 4

Then submit jobs from a mix of users (or accounting groups) and job priorities, with at least one submitter going the defined max_global_job_prios and one submitter not. 

C:\home\tannenba\condor\build_79\test>cat test1.sub
executable = c:\utils\date.exe
initialdir = c:\temp
+AccountingGroup = "groupA"
priority = 1
queue 1
priority = 5
queue 3
priority = 10
queue 3
priority = -5
queue 2
priority = 15
queue

C:\home\tannenba\condor\build_79\test>cat test2.sub
executable = c:\utils\date.exe
initialdir = c:\temp
+AccountingGroup = "groupB"
priority = 100
queue 1
priority = 50
queue 3
priority = -5
queue 2

C:\home\tannenba\condor\build_79\test>condor_submit test1.sub
Submitting job(s)
..........
10 job(s) submitted to cluster 124.

C:\home\tannenba\condor\build_79\test>condor_submit test2.sub
Submitting job(s)
......
6 job(s) submitted to cluster 125.

So the above results in two submitter ads. Check the attributes JobPrioArray and JobPrioArrayOverflow for correctness. 

C:\home\tannenba\condor\build_79\test>condor_status -submit

Name                 Machine      Running IdleJobs HeldJobs

groupA@ToddsThinkpad ToddsThink         0       10        0
groupB@ToddsThinkpad ToddsThink         0        6        0
                           RunningJobs           IdleJobs           HeldJobs

groupA@ToddsThinkpad                 0                 10                  0
groupB@ToddsThinkpad                 0                  6                  0

               Total                 0                 16                  0

C:\home\tannenba\condor\build_79\test>condor_status -l -submit groupA@ToddsThinkpad | grep JobPrioArray
JobPrioArrayOverflow = 5
JobPrioArray = "15,10,5,1"

C:\home\tannenba\condor\build_79\test>condor_status -l -submit groupB@ToddsThinkpad | grep JobPrioArray
JobPrioArray = "100,50,-5"

Note only the first job has a JobPrioArrayOverflow attribute because it has five unique priorities and the limit was configured to be four. Also note JobPrioArray priories are sorted large to small.

2012-Oct-08 14:30:50 by tannenba:
Note - this is an implementation milestone ticket. See master ticket #3218 for code review, documentation, etc.

2012-Oct-09 14:39:41 by gthain:
I've reviewed this part of the code ticket, and it looks good. A couple of questions: There's some wonky copy-and-paste issues with the param table, in particular the URL parameter and version parameters.

Also, should we make the publication of these parameter dependent on the knob? Seems like more code paths. Why not always publish the job prio arrays, and only conditionally act on them.
check_ins: 2012-Oct-08 14:26   Check-in [33601]: Add JobPrioArray and JobPrioArrayOverflow attrs to submitter ad. #3255 These attributes are used by the negotiator to honor job priories across multiple schedds. This commit also introduces a consolidated method to create a submitter ad, removing code clones. Parent ticket #3218 (By Todd Tannenbaum )
creator: tannenba
